I think so.  Or you can just add "icedtea6-plugin-" to the end of the install command with aptitude /or/ apt-get (but note the trailing -)
icedtea6-plugin pulls in the whole openjdk6 stack
sudo aptitude install --no-suggests openjdk-7-jre  <-- doesn't work, "aptitude: unrecognised option '--no-suggests'"
Ah.
Try running "sudo aptitude install openjdk-7-jre icedtea6-plugin:" (with the trailing : - it tells it to leave that package in the state it's in.)
no, still wants to install those java6 things
Hmm, I'm nearly out of ideas, then.  You could try telling it (at the y/n prompt) :<packagename> to get it to keep those packages uninstalled.
